div.p: Katib A Distributed General AutoML Platform Based on Kubernetes
Jinan Zhou1, Andrey Velichkevich1, Kirill Prosvirov1, Anubhav Garg1, Yuji Oshima2, Debo Dutta1
Part I: Introduction What is Katib Why develop Katib

Automated Machine Learning (AutoML) is the automation of the end to end process of applying machine learning to real-world problems. The primary challenge is designing the model for a specific task by Hyperparameter Tuning or Neural Architecture Search.
Katib is a general platform to run AutoML tasks in distributed systems. It is built on k8s and is part of Kubeflow, an open source machine learning toolkit for k8s.
Kubernetes (k8s) is an open-source system for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.
Why Develop Katib? To tackle the most central problems in deploying AutoML workflows.
Problems in AutoML Solutions by Katib
Part II: AutoML Workflows Hyperparameter Tuning Neural Architecture Search
Find an optimal hyperparameter so that can be minimized or maximized.
is usually regarded as a black box. Commonly used algorithms:
A neural network is represented by a directed acyclic graph (DAG) , where a vertex denotes the latent representation in layer and a directed edge denotes an operation
whose input is and output is given to . The value of the vertex depends on all the incoming edges:
is a function to combine all the inputs. It can be weighted sum, concatenation, etc., depending on the algorithm.
Workflow for NAS with modification approaches
Workflow for NAS with generation approaches
Needs a Model Constructor: o In HPT, the model is already
specified. In NAS, however, we need to find the model
o Interpret the representations given by the suggestion
Different searching strategies o Search for a network o Search for a cell
Different evolving strategies o Evolve by generation o Evolve by modification
All the AutoML Workflows run in an iterative manner.
Integrate all model representation interpretation functions needed by different NAS algorithms into Model Manager.
HPT and NAS workflows can be naturally unified in one system

Scalable Can be deployed at large scale.
User friendly Powerful CLI for experts
Extendible Easy to be customized for
